intro: Dehaasia lanyuensis, commonly known as the Lanyu mountain fern, is a rare and endemic species found exclusively on the island of Lanyu in Taiwan. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinct, serrated margin. The plant thrives in the moist, shaded understory of subtropical forests, where it relies on consistent humidity and nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dehaasia lanyuensis is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat degradation and climate change.
